vocabulary.example: The demolition expert carefully detonated the explosives to bring down the building.

vocabulary.definition: a long high sea wave caused by an earthquake, submarine landslide, or other disturbance.
vocabulary.example: The tsunami warning sirens blared as people evacuated the coastal areas.

vocabulary.definition: a mountain or hill, typically conical, having a crater or vent through which lava, rock fragments, hot vapor, and gas are being or have been erupted from the earth's crust.
vocabulary.example: The eruption of the volcano spewed ash and lava, covering the nearby villages.

vocabulary.definition: tear or pull (something) quickly or forcibly away from something or someone.
vocabulary.example: The strong winds ripped the roof off the house during the storm.

vocabulary.definition: relating to earthquakes or other vibrations of the earth and its crust.
vocabulary.example: The seismologist studied the seismic activity in the region to predict potential earthquakes.

vocabulary.definition: an event involving destruction or damage on an awesome or catastrophic scale.
vocabulary.example: The movie depicted a post-apocalyptic world where survivors struggled to rebuild civilization.
